title: Hyundai Aura Corporate trim launched at Rs 7.48 lakh
description: Hyundai has launched a new Corporate trim of the Aura sedan, with the petrol variant priced at Rs 7.48 lakh ex-showroom and the CNG variant at Rs 8.47 lakh. The Corporate trim sits between the existing S and SX trims. Aura Corporate is positioned between S and SX trims It’s available in petrol and CNG versions with manual gearbox Hyundai Aura Corporate: what’s new? The Aura Corporate trim adds some features to the second-from-base S trim. The most important among them are a 6.5-inch touchscreen inside and LED daytime running lamps. It also has 15-inch steel wheels with wheel covers, a rear wing spoiler, a tyre pressure monitoring system, rear AC vents and an armrest with cup holders. The exterior also bears a Corporate emblem. Under the hood, the Aura Corporate has a 1.2-litre, four-cylinder petrol engine producing 83hp and 114Nm of torque. In the CNG spec, this engine makes 69hp and 95Nm of torque. However, this trim is only available with the 5-speed manual gearbox. The Aura Corporate variants cost Rs 10,000 more than the S variants. The prices for the Aura sedan range between Rs 6.54 lakh and Rs 9.11 lakh.   Also See:  Volkswagen entry level EV teased ahead of 2027 global debut MG Astor 1.3-litre turbo-petrol engine axed

html:
The new Corporate trim adds more features to the second-from-base S trim.

Hyundai has launched a new Corporate trim of the Aura sedan, with the petrol variant priced at Rs 7.48 lakh ex-showroom and the CNG variant at Rs 8.47 lakh. The Corporate trim sits between the existing S and SX trims.

  1. Aura Corporate is positioned between S and SX trims
  2. It’s available in petrol and CNG versions with manual gearbox

Hyundai Aura Corporate: what’s new?

The Aura Corporate trim adds some features to the second-from-base S trim. The most important among them are a 6.5-inch touchscreen inside and LED daytime running lamps. It also has 15-inch steel wheels with wheel covers, a rear wing spoiler, a tyre pressure monitoring system, rear AC vents and an armrest with cup holders. The exterior also bears a Corporate emblem.

Under the hood, the Aura Corporate has a 1.2-litre, four-cylinder petrol engine producing 83hp and 114Nm of torque. In the CNG spec, this engine makes 69hp and 95Nm of torque. However, this trim is only available with the 5-speed manual gearbox.

The Aura Corporate variants cost Rs 10,000 more than the S variants. The prices for the Aura sedan range between Rs 6.54 lakh and Rs 9.11 lakh.
